name: Surf
body:
##Description

_Surf_ is an open source framework for simplifying system development on AWS. _Surf_ is used for collecting data across multiple technologies (messaging, logging, applications, etc.) to _Amazon Kinesis_. It also enables rapid development of Kinesis applications that are based on collected streaming data.

![Surf Image](images/surf_image.PNG)

_Surf_ can be deployed as a server connecting to several devices at once. Or it can be used as a library, providing an abstracted view of _Kinesis_ API. _Surf_ has a small run-time footprint and is easily extensible. We intend on keeping it up-to-date with emerging user requirements and active projects.

##Why Open Source IoT/M2M with AWS?

Innovation in IoT/M2M space comes from two areas – _devices _and _applications_. The connectivity fabric, operations, scaling, application integration and other platform capabilities are critical for a functioning system, but not differentiating.

Today such platform capabilities are commonly provided either by Telecoms or by purpose-built products. In either case, the platforms severely limit developer’s abilities to experiment, leverage open-source community, and scale-as-you-go.

We believe that the combination of open-source frameworks and operational simplicity of AWS provides a powerful alternative to proprietary IoT/M2M platforms.

![AWS Image](images/aws_image.PNG)

_Surf_ is our initial step towards open source IoT/M2M frameworks.

##Capabilities

Data sources - File-tailer, HTTP, SDK
Edge processing - filtering

##Futures

Our objective is to extend _Surf_ as practical requirements emerge. Please, contribute your thoughts and commentaries on our _Surf_ Forum [here](https://github.com/bbnow/surf-landing-page/generated_pages/forum).
